page.title: 04LAW AND ORDER IN EPSOM
page.content: In Epsom there are 60 policemen, 9 cars, and 11 dogs. At any one time there are 10 men on the beat. Busiest hours are between 10 PM and 4 AM at weekends. Every week about 18 people are taken in for crimes like drunken driving, assault and theft. Most of the accused are tried at Epsom Magistrates' Court or the Juvenile Court. In the Magistrates' Court 200 to 250 cases are heard a week by the 38 justices in the 2 court rooms. Cases take 10 minutes with a guilty plea or all day with a non-guilty plea. The accused are sent to the police station overnight but can't be kept there for more than 3 days. If they are found guilty they can be sent to Brixton and if they are under 21 they are sent to the Lewis Remand Centre. Cases demanding a jury go to a Crown Court such as at Kingston.
